contentrichtext.text: '''Public ownership''' is the concept of a community taking possession of assets or an [[Organization|enterprise]] to achieve an aim that cannot be achieved through [[private property]], typically in pursuit of the [[public interest]] or [[social justice]]. The public owner could be a local [[municipality]] or [[council]], the government of a [[nation state]], or a supra-national organisation. The process of creating a publicly owned enterprise is variously described as [[nationalisation]], [[socialisation]], [[municipalisation]], in contrast to the returning assets to private parties through [[privatisation]]. ==See also== *[[Public service law in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Nationalization]] [[Category:Economic systems]] [[Category:Political economy]] [[Category:Property law]]
